metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9028 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in stream_decoder.c in libFLAC before 1.3.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted .flac file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9028` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flac - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.14.04.1
libflac++6 - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.14.04.1
libflac8 - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> android moved from libflac 1.2.1 to 1.3.1, plus extra fix listed below jdstrand> as with previous stagefright issues, this issue affects Ubuntu's android packages, but not in a way that is exposed to apps.  See CVE-2015-1538 for details

criterions.comment: android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
flac package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-2ubuntu0.14.04.1').
